metadata.dc:author: Domínguez Rodríguez, P
Gallardo López, A
Gómez Honrubia, M C
Lafuente Gormaz, C
Aguilera Saldaña, M A
Gallego Page, J C
metadata.dc:description: We describe the clinical case of a patient with acute myocardial infarction treated with t-PA fibrinolysis, who developed renal failure and cutaneous lesions of the livedo reticularis type, probably caused by embolization of cholesterol crystals. The main characteristics of this rare clinical entity are reviewed.
metadata.dc:title: Lesiones cutáneas e insuficiencia renal tras infarto agudo de miocardio.
[Skin lesions and renal failure after myocardial infarction].
